species.name: Bulbasaur
species.dex-entry: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.

species.name: Ivysaur
species.dex-entry: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

species.name: Venusaur
species.dex-entry: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

species.name: Charmander
species.dex-entry: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

species.name: Charmeleon
species.dex-entry: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

species.name: Charizard
species.dex-entry: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

species.name: Squirtle
species.dex-entry: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

species.name: Wartortle
species.dex-entry: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

species.name: Blastoise
species.dex-entry: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.

species.name: Caterpie
species.dex-entry: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

species.name: Metapod
species.dex-entry: This Pokémon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

species.name: Butterfree
species.dex-entry: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed, releasing highly toxic dust into the air.

species.name: Weedle
species.dex-entry: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp, venomous stinger on its head.

species.name: Kakuna
species.dex-entry: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

species.name: Beedrill
species.dex-entry: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

species.name: Pidgey
species.dex-entry: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

species.name: Pidgeotto
species.dex-entry: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

species.name: Pidgeot
species.dex-entry: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

species.name: Rattata
species.dex-entry: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

species.name: Raticate
species.dex-entry: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance and will slow down if they are cut off.

species.name: Spearow
species.dex-entry: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

species.name: Fearow
species.dex-entry: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

species.name: Ekans
species.dex-entry: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as Pidgey and Spearow, whole.

species.name: Arbok
species.dex-entry: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

species.name: Pikachu
species.dex-entry: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

species.name: Raichu
species.dex-entry: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

species.name: Sandshrew
species.dex-entry: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

species.name: Sandslash
species.dex-entry: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

species.name: Nidoran♀
species.dex-entry: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

species.name: Nidorina
species.dex-entry: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

species.name: Nidoqueen
species.dex-entry: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

species.name: Nidoran♂
species.dex-entry: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.

species.name: Nidorino
species.dex-entry: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

species.name: Nidoking
species.dex-entry: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey's bones.

species.name: Clefairy
species.dex-entry: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

species.name: Clefable
species.dex-entry: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

species.name: Vulpix
species.dex-entry: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

species.name: Ninetales
species.dex-entry: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.

species.name: Jigglypuff
species.dex-entry: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

species.name: Wigglytuff
species.dex-entry: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

species.name: Zubat
species.dex-entry: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

species.name: Golbat
species.dex-entry: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

species.name: Oddish
species.dex-entry: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.

species.name: Gloom
species.dex-entry: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

species.name: Vileplume
species.dex-entry: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

species.name: Paras
species.dex-entry: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.

species.name: Parasect
species.dex-entry: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

species.name: Venonat
species.dex-entry: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats bugs. It is attracted by light at night.

species.name: Venomoth
species.dex-entry: The dustlike scales covering its wings are color-coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

species.name: Diglett
species.dex-entry: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

species.name: Dugtrio
species.dex-entry: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

species.name: Meowth
species.dex-entry: Adores circular objects. Wanders the street on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

species.name: Persian
species.dex-entry: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

species.name: Psyduck
species.dex-entry: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

species.name: Golduck
species.dex-entry: Often seen swimming elegantly by lakeshores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster Kappa.

species.name: Mankey
species.dex-entry: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.

species.name: Primeape
species.dex-entry: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.

species.name: Growlithe
species.dex-entry: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

species.name: Arcanine
species.dex-entry: A Pokémon that has been admired since the past for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

species.name: Poliwag
species.dex-entry: Its newly grown legs prevent it from walking well. It appears to prefer swimming over walking.

species.name: Poliwhirl
species.dex-entry: It can live in or out of water. When out of water, it constantly sweats to keep its body slimy.

species.name: Poliwrath
species.dex-entry: A swimmer adept at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

species.name: Abra
species.dex-entry: Using its ability to read minds, it will sense impending danger and teleport to safety.

species.name: Kadabra
species.dex-entry: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.

species.name: Alakazam
species.dex-entry: Its brain can outperform a super-computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.

species.name: Machop
species.dex-entry: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

species.name: Machoke
species.dex-entry: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

species.name: Machamp
species.dex-entry: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

species.name: Bellsprout
species.dex-entry: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It appears to use its root feet to replenish moisture.

species.name: Weepinbell
species.dex-entry: It spits out Poison Powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of acid.

species.name: Victreebel
species.dex-entry: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

species.name: Tentacool
species.dex-entry: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

species.name: Tentacruel
species.dex-entry: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

species.name: Geodude
species.dex-entry: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

species.name: Graveler
species.dex-entry: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

species.name: Golem
species.dex-entry: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without taking damage.

species.name: Ponyta
species.dex-entry: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in moments.

species.name: Rapidash
species.dex-entry: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

species.name: Slowpoke
species.dex-entry: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

species.name: Slowbro
species.dex-entry: The Shellder that latches onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's leftover scraps.

species.name: Magnemite
species.dex-entry: Uses antigravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.

species.name: Magneton
species.dex-entry: Formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

species.name: Farfetch'd
species.dex-entry: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.

species.name: Doduo
species.dex-entry: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

species.name: Dodrio
species.dex-entry: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head is said to stay awake.

species.name: Seel
species.dex-entry: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.

species.name: Dewgong
species.dex-entry: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

species.name: Grimer
species.dex-entry: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

species.name: Muk
species.dex-entry: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

species.name: Shellder
species.dex-entry: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

species.name: Cloyster
species.dex-entry: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

species.name: Gastly
species.dex-entry: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

species.name: Haunter
species.dex-entry: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

species.name: Gengar
species.dex-entry: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

species.name: Onix
species.dex-entry: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.

species.name: Drowzee
species.dex-entry: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

species.name: Hypno
species.dex-entry: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

species.name: Krabby
species.dex-entry: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

species.name: Kingler
species.dex-entry: The large pincer has 10,000-horsepower crushing force. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.

species.name: Voltorb
species.dex-entry: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a [[Poké Ball]], it has zapped many people.

species.name: Electrode
species.dex-entry: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

species.name: Exeggcute
species.dex-entry: It is often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they gather quickly and attack in swarms.

species.name: Exeggutor
species.dex-entry: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

species.name: Cubone
species.dex-entry: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this Pokémon's real face.

species.name: Marowak
species.dex-entry: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

species.name: Hitmonlee
species.dex-entry: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

species.name: Hitmonchan
species.dex-entry: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see.

species.name: Lickitung
species.dex-entry: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.

species.name: Koffing
species.dex-entry: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

species.name: Weezing
species.dex-entry: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, two Koffings can fuse into a Weezing over many years.

species.name: Rhyhorn
species.dex-entry: Its massive bones are 1000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

species.name: Rhydon
species.dex-entry: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.

species.name: Chansey
species.dex-entry: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.

species.name: Tangela
species.dex-entry: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. The vines sway as it walks.

species.name: Kangaskhan
species.dex-entry: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is 3 years old.

species.name: Horsea
species.dex-entry: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

species.name: Seadra
species.dex-entry: Capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

species.name: Goldeen
species.dex-entry: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.

species.name: Seaking
species.dex-entry: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

species.name: Staryu
species.dex-entry: An enigmatic Pokémon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

species.name: Starmie
species.dex-entry: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

species.name: Mr. Mime
species.dex-entry: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.

species.name: Scyther
species.dex-entry: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.

species.name: Jynx
species.dex-entry: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

species.name: Electabuzz
species.dex-entry: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

species.name: Magmar
species.dex-entry: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

species.name: Pinsir
species.dex-entry: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.

species.name: Tauros
species.dex-entry: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

species.name: Magikarp
species.dex-entry: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

species.name: Gyarados
species.dex-entry: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

species.name: Lapras
species.dex-entry: A Pokémon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.

species.name: Ditto
species.dex-entry: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

species.name: Eevee
species.dex-entry: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from [[evolutionary stone

species.name: Vaporeon
species.dex-entry: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

species.name: Jolteon
species.dex-entry: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000-volt lightning bolts.

species.name: Flareon
species.dex-entry: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1,600 degrees.

species.name: Porygon
species.dex-entry: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

species.name: Omanyte
species.dex-entry: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

species.name: Omastar
species.dex-entry: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.

species.name: Kabuto
species.dex-entry: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

species.name: Kabutops
species.dex-entry: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

species.name: Aerodactyl
species.dex-entry: A ferocious, prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

species.name: Snorlax
species.dex-entry: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

species.name: Articuno
species.dex-entry: A legendary bird Pokémon said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

species.name: Zapdos
species.dex-entry: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

species.name: Moltres
species.dex-entry: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a giant dazzle of flashing flames.

species.name: Dratini
species.dex-entry: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

species.name: Dragonair
species.dex-entry: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

species.name: Dragonite
species.dex-entry: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokémon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

species.name: Mewtwo
species.dex-entry: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

species.name: Mew
species.dex-entry: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
